meanings.definition: The total length or area of film or tape used in a movie or television program.
meanings.sent1: The footages of the movie were so long that it felt like it would never end.
meanings.sent2: The director needed more footages to complete the documentary.
meanings.sent3: The comedy show had so many footages that it made the audience laugh non-stop.
meanings.sent4: Her memories played in her mind like footages on a never-ending reel.
meanings.sent5: The footages of the wildlife documentary were breathtaking and captivating.

meanings.definition: The amount of space taken up by something in terms of length or area.
meanings.sent1: The footages of the new furniture in the room made it feel cramped.
meanings.sent2: The architect calculated the exact footages needed for the building's construction.
meanings.sent3: The footages of the picnic blanket were not enough for the whole family.
meanings.sent4: Her excitement filled the room, taking up all the available footages.
meanings.sent5: The footages of the garden showed how much space the plants occupied.
